name: Sara Lindqvist
role: Detective, Economic Crime Division, Malmö Police
core_wound: Her father was a dock worker at Limhamn who lost his job to automation. She watched him become obsolete. Now she investigates crimes she barely understands, feeling the same creeping obsolescence.
wants: To solve these algorithmic crime cases and prove human investigators still matter
needs: To accept that understanding the systems doesn't mean she can beat them alone - collaboration and humility are required
voice_markers: Direct, minimal small talk - gets to the point
Uses technical terms correctly but admits when she doesn't understand
Dry humor, often self-deprecating about her tech skills
Code-switches: professional Swedish with colleagues, more casual with Emil
Often thinks in analogies to translate tech concepts to human terms
contradiction: She resents automation for displacing workers, but relies on automated systems for investigations. She's part of the problem she criticizes.
knowledge_state: Experienced with traditional economic crime (fraud, embezzlement)
Basic understanding of ML and AI - has done some training courses
Knows Malmö's criminal ecosystem from 15 years on the force
Personally knew victims of automation (her father, former colleagues)

relationships.Emil Bergström: Colleague and friend. She trusts his technical expertise but worries he's becoming cynical and burned out.
relationships.Yusuf Hassan: Unknown at start. Will develop as cat-and-mouse respect between adversaries.
relationships.Katarina Ek: Unknown at start. Will develop as complicated sympathy - understands her economic desperation.
relationships.Chen Wei: Unknown at start. Will see her as a weak link, potential informant.

background.education: Police academy, later criminology degree, recent cybercrime courses
background.family: Divorced, no children. Father deceased (early death linked to depression after job loss). Mother lives in Västerås.
background.residence: Small apartment in Värnhem, older neighborhood. Deliberately chose not to live in a 'smart building'.

skills: Traditional detective work: interviews, physical evidence, case building
Understanding economic incentives and criminal markets
Persistence and pattern recognition in case files
weaknesses: Limited technical skills - needs Emil for deep tech work
Stubborn - resists asking for help or admitting knowledge gaps
Holds grudges - her resentment of automation colors her judgment
Workaholic - uses cases to avoid processing personal issues
